text: The Megadrive sound hardware could do absolutely amazing things when programmed properly, and this game is a sterling example.  When done right, it just sounds so clean compared with the sampled music you'd get in the SNES.

text: This completely overlooked/forgotten game was/is actually quite a lot of fun. I have the Gen cartridge and I also had this for a old Amiga computer back then as well.

text: Is there anything better than a friday night with a nice weekend ahead? I haven't played this Contra clone, but this is the kind of theme that does the Genesis audio chip great justice. It reminds me of something you'd hear in the Turrican series. Awesomely rockin' music.
author: SupraDarky

text: I agree with you man. Nothin' better than a Friday night. XD
author: Medal Melodies

text: I thought, Hitoshi Sakimoto composed this. Check out his work on the Mega Drive - great stuff.
author: Radoslav Mitrov

text: @Radoslav Mitrov Technically, Sakimoto didn't compose it, but rather he arranged the Genesis/Megadrive version. And to be honest, this is even better than the original arcade version.
author: FMFlameNinja

text: This soundtrack reminds me of Tyrian, probably the best PC spaceshooter out there, from the mythic year of 1996. The extra episodes released after arc 3 suck, but hunt down Tyrian 2000 and give it a try if you like spaceships and modular upgrades.
author: svankensen

text:
@svankensen Speaking of which, Tyrian 2000 is free:
http://www.gog.com/game/tyrian_2000
